html: The lives of Jehovah’s righteous people are oriented around Jehovah and the terms of his covenants. The personal pronouns “me” and “my” show that it is a person’s individual choice, not a collective psyche, that leads into Jehovah’s presence—that righteousness is learned through one’s own volition. Jehovah’s ordinances serve as a channel to that soul or spirit who yearns for him and seeks after him night and day. Jehovah’s raising up his end-time servant—his righteousness—accelerates his people’s preparation throughout the earth for Jehovah’s anticipated coming (Isaiah 46:11-13; 51:1, 4-8; 56:1).
